location: 8TH STREET BETWEEN AVENUES C AND D

text: A group of dark-skinned girls wearing cheerleading outfit align themselves in formation on the sidewalk. They begin dance. No music can be heard. The sound of the girls' bod is our soundtrack. We hear their strained breathing, palm and sneaker bottoms pounding while they hum and count sof to themselves in an effort to keep the rhythm.

SLO-MO: We explore the bodies of the dancers; their brigh eyes and sweaty brows, their stomping feet and colliding  hands (dark side and light side). The younger girls perfo provocative dance movements, the older girls repeat them.
Their bodies silhouette in the bright sunlight.

AMANDA, a tall 14-year-old exits the front door of her  apartment budding with her headphones in one hand and a  magazine in the other. She sits down on her stoop, puts h headphones on and presses "play". We can hear the sound o Salsa leaking out of the sides of her headphones. JENETTE ten years old with big black hair in rubber-band restrain the sidewalk below Amanda drawing with a piece of chalk. looks over her shoulder and sees Amanda reading her magaz climbs the stairs and sits down beside her.

The camera pans to reveal AARON, an 18-year-old boy on th other side of the street, unloading some fireworks from t trunk of a car. He's filling a paper bag with them,  carefully making sure not to reveal what he's doing to  onlookers.
At the ear end of the block, DONNA, 14, and MICHELLE, 12, sit and watch Aaron at work.
How does he look up close?
(Amorously)
Umm, he got dark brownish  eyes, he got a nice nose I  love his nose. I love his  skin. I love his lips, he  got a great smile and he  got-
A bad attitude.
Yeah, he got a bad  attitude.
You said before, that he  got boxes?
SLO-MO: The camera is very close to Aaron. Details of his body in a shallow depth of field.
Yeah, he got boxes in his  stomach. He's taller than  me.
How old is he?
I think he's 18 or 17.
You gonna talk to him?
Um, yeah I think so.
Back on Amanda's stoop.
You still like him.
(With a sigh of negative attitude)
No.
HECTOR, a mature-looking 13-year old is crossing the  street. He enters frame with Amanda and Jenette.
Yo, wuzzup.
Amanda ignores him.
Hi Hector
(To Amanda)
Oh, you're not gonna say  hello.

AMANDA'S POV: Donna approaches Aaron as he locks up the  trunk of the car. She hesitantly calls over to him. He  acknowledges her with a lift of the chin. Making sure he  keeps his distance from her, he looks around to see if  anyone is watching him. He tosses his head for her to  follow. He begins to walk away down the block. She follow
Hector is looking at Amanda. He appears to have run out o things to say. Amanda removes her headphones. Her music  becomes clearer, more audible.
Yo, you gonna keep me  hangin' like dat?
Hector, Yo try to rap to me every day, why don't you  take your three-quarters retarded ass outta here?
Yo, you betta give me my  respects or I'll tell your  little girl ova here what  I heard about you and my  boy.
Amanda puts her headphones back on.
HECTOR looks like he got a new girl anyway.

location: 8TH STREET BETWEEN AVENUES C AND D

text: VICTOR, a skinny 12-year-old with sloppy hair, is asleep the sun on his fire escape. There is sweat beaded up on h body. His shirt is rolled up behind his head like a pillo His breath is heavy, his chest rises and falls. The camer tilts to reveal CARLOS, ten, rounding the corner on the  street below. The camera tracks backwards as Carlos  approaches. He is talking to himself.
(To himself)
Whatcha gonna do when ya  bitch is untrue?
Carlos lifts his head up to look at the fire escapes.
Yo Victor!
The camera pans and tilts up to the fire escapes. The  buildings float by. He arrives in front of Victor's  building and cups his hand around his mouth.
Yo Victor!
On the fire escape, Victor's eyes pop open and the sun  shines into them.
(Dazed)
What, wuzzup?
Victor sits up and looks over the side of the fire escape
Come down!
I can't!
Why?
I got punished, man.
Fa what?
I won't let my motha cut  my hair.
Wha'?
She fucks it all up!
Forget it! C'mon Let's go  to the pool.
I can't man, I'm punished!
Who gives!
I can't, I'm gonna get  punished more!
Trust me, I always get  into trouble, c'mon!
Victor sits down on the fire escape. Carlos pauses for a  minute and turns his back on Victor.
C'mon! The girls are  waiting for you!
Victor hops back up.
(interested)
They are?
Yeah! Tell me which one you would like. To be doin'  nothin on a fire escape or beat the pool with a bunch of  girls? Be straight up!
I'll be right down.
Victor climbs down the fire escape and hops down to the  street. he immediately grabs Carlos and starts pushing hi down the block to avoid being seen from above.

location: THE CORNER OF 8TH STREET AND AVENUE D

text: The boys safely round the corner onto Avenue D. Victor  perks up and starts nudging Carlos.
So what girls are over  there?
Natasha, Maria, Tina-
These are the pretty girls  you told me to come down  for?
Victor sighs and runs his fingers through his hair.
What's the difference, you  never do anything anyway
Victor makes a disagreeing gesture. Carlos drags Victor  Downtown.
What are you going that  way for?
I'm not goin' to 10th  Street, people piss and  shit in that pool,
Where you goin'?
Pitt.
Oh man, what we gotta  leave ar' own neighborhood  for?
C'mon.
Man, if I go down you're  goin' down with me.
MONTAGE: Victor and Carlos hang on each other as they wal Avenue D towards the Pitt Street Pool. They pass by Victo giving him an impromptu smack and then bang on a store wi hello to a friend.

From Victor's POV we work our way through a crowd of peop an cross 3rd Street. Victor looks back at the crowd with watchful eye. The camera tracks along in the street as th boys walk along the sidewalk. Victor looks up at a street sign. It reads, "Houston St." As the boys make their way  across the wide intersection, the heat is slightly visibl as car exhaust fills the gridlocked lanes. Victor and  Carlos walk calmly, with space between them, making their way towards the camera in a shallow depth of field as we  follow focus on them.
Victor and Carlos stand on line outside the pool gates. P examine the boys as they slowly inch their way into the p
From Victor's POV we see the expanse of the pool as he  enters the park. We watch as he surveys the area.
From a high angle we see Carlos nudge Victor to make his  way onto the pool deck. They enter the crowd, proceeding  carefully, making sure not to bump anyone.
As they continue to walk, Victor's POV reveals the bodies of older boys and girls, rough water and mischievous kids
Amanda is sitting poolside with Jenette.
And that girl, over there?  Hoochie.
Jenette looks out across the pool trying to see who Amand is talking about.
And him. Stay away from  him, he's only interested  in that.
Amanda points between Jenette's legs.
That right there.
Carlos steps in front of them, Amanda smacks his leg.
Yo Amanda, wassup?
They kiss on the cheek.
(To Victor)
Amanda is Eddie's cousin.
Eddie from Compost?
No, Baruch.
A girl swimming in the pool calls over to Carlos.
Carlos! Carlos, get your  skinny ass over here!
(To Victor)
Stay right here, I'll be  right back.
Carlos walks off leaving Victor standing next to Amanda a Jenette. Victor looks uncomfortable.
Who are you?
I'm wit' Carlos.
Amanda points out across the pool.
(To Jenette)
Him right there, That's  who I'm talkin' about.  (to Victor)
Excuse me, can you move, I  can't see.
Amanda spots Aaron and Donna in the distance.
Do you have a name?
Victor.
What?
Victor.
Amanda turns to Jenette and continues talking to her.
Umm, I'm gonna go find  Carlos.
As Victor turns to walk, the camera pans to follow him,  revealing Hector who is approaching Amanda. The camera th pans back to Amanda. She sighs and turns her ahead away  from him.
In the playground area at the Pitt Street Pool, Aaron is impression of Al Pacino. Darrell and Boy 1 look on.
(to Boy 1)
You wanna meet my little  friend?
Boy 1 is laughing at Aaron. Donna and Michelle stand near watching.
Don't fuck wit' me! Don't  fuck wit' me. (pointing his finger)
My lawyer's so good he'll  have you workin in Alaska,  so dress warn.
Aaron, how you doin'?
Fine.
Look at me.
What?
Why you have an attitude  for?
Not now, I'm busy
God, I just wanna speak to  you. I just wanna speak  to you the way I feel  about you.
Hurry up, you're wastin'  my time, what the fuck.
Aaron turns back to his friends.
Please don't scream at me.  I like you, but I don't  like the way your attitude  is.
So get the fuck outta  here.
Darrell and Boy 1 approve. They wait for Donna's reply.
I wanna go out with you, I  want to be part of your  life. I want you to treat  me the way a girlfriend  should be treated.
Then don't go out with me.
For once in your life have  some         respect for me,  don't even curse at me or  nothin'.
(to Darrell)
Now she's tellin' me what  the fuck to do.
God, you drive me crazy. I  just want you to know how  I feel and you don't          understand.
Just get the fuck outta  here.
Donna stares at Aaron as he turns back to his friends.  Michelle walks up to Donna and gently leads her away.
That girl be trippin'.  (Back into his Pacino impression)
One time I let her kiss my  rings and forever  she tries to repay me!
Victor and Carlos are playing, trying to force each other underwater.  Carlos squirts water through his lips.
I gotta go take a piss.
If we were at 10th Street  Pool you woulda done it  right in the water, right?
The camera pans as Victor climbs out of the pool and onto long line. As he stands and waits, Amanda can be seen in  the background arguing with Hector.
In the water, Carlos makes a face at Victor. Victor makes one back.
(Under his breath to Carlos)
I'm gonna beat you.
Hector and Amanda have been arguing. Jenette is sitting o beneath  them.
I know you likes me.
I eave me alone!
Why don't you share the  wealth a little bit?
Hector grabs her wrist.
Excuse me! I gotta go to  the ladies' room!
Amanda gets on line behind Victor as he continues to anta Carlos in the  distance. Amanda recognizes Victor from behind, peeking  over his shoulder at the side of his face.
Shorty!
Victor turns around to Amanda.
Wussup?
Wussup.
He turns back around.
Yo shorty!
Victor turns back around.
What?
Amanda hears something over her shoulder and spins her he around.
(to Hector)
Leave me alone!  (To Victor)
Yo, I know another  bathroom over there, c'mon  this line's too long.
Amanda takes Victor by the hand and walks towards Hector. She bumps into him with Victor.
Excuse us.
Amanda gives Hector a snotty grin.
She drags Victor away.
In a small corner, out of sight to the rest of the kids a Amanda  complains to Victor. Victor looks confused.
This fucking guy be  followin' me around, and  touchin' me. Asshole!
She sighs and pulls on the bathroom door. It's locked. Sh gives it another try. It won't budge.
Look, just do me a favor.  Stand right here, okay?

Amanda takes Victor's hand for balance and squats down,  pulling her bathing suit bottoms to the side. She urinate Victor watches her, trying to play it cool. The camera  tilts up from Amanda's face peeking up at Victor, to thei hands straining for balance, to Victor's wandering eyes.

CHRISTOPHER, an energetic ten-year-old, exits the front d building  holding a bat, sits down on the curb and looks out at the the camera  pans, we see Aaron on the corner talking to Mari. (Up to the window)
Ma!
No answer.
Ma!
Mom's head sticks out the window.
Cross me!
Mom waves her hand, signaling to him that it's safe to  cross the street. Chris, picking up a half-deflated  football, runs into the street.
Chris makes his way down the block, stomping along in big High-tops. He spots Aaron a few feet away.
Aaron is sitting on the sidewalk crushing a soda bottle u foot.
Chris approaches and tosses the ball to him.
Aaron stands up and tosses the ball back to Chris, then  lights a cigarette. Chris waits until Aaron is ready and  throws again.
It's too hot, get outta  here.
Michelle and Donna are sitting on their stoop.
I want him to change. I  want to get to know the  real him and I want him to  get to know the real me.

It's so frustrating. I ask  him if he's mad and he  says no.
Victor is still sitting on the sidewalk around the corner
Chris walks by him.
Yo! You live here?

You know Amanda?
Chris nods again, smiles and throws the ball at Victor.  Victor catches it and throws it back. Chris catches it an then starts to run away.

Hold up, yo!
Chris slips through a fence to enter the alleyway and Vic behind him.  A "No Trespassing" sign hangs on the gate. Victor looks a little as they continue their game of catch.

Alright, tell me, what'd  you hear?

Alright.

He kisses her forehead. The camera follows as Aaron's lip make their way to Donna's. They kiss. Slowly at first, th deeply.

How's Hector?

Hector-

Yo! Get over here!

The sun has dropped low in the sky. Long shadows rest on  The pavement after a steamy afternoon.
Amanda's block is quiet and empty.
Chris strolls by Amanda's stoop.
He notices Jenette's drawing, bends down on his knees and reads her sloppy writing.
"For entrance to secret passage press here."
Chris presses his finger into the circle she's drawn. A  moment passes. Nothing happens.

She sits down on her stoop.
Victor is sitting on the curb across the street tapping a empty bottle against the pavement. He sees Amanda.

Yo.
Hi.

So watcha doin'?

No.  (He sighs)
